page.title: 14TRANSPORT IN BREICH VALLEY
page.content: In our class of 22 pupils only five families have cars. This is normal for our area and means that most people have to rely on public transport. The most popular form of transport is bus.There are half hourly services from both Stoneyburn and Addiewell to Livingston and Bathgate. Breich is not so well served but it does have an hourly service. No part of this area is more than 10 minutes by road from the M8 motorway which runs between Glasgow and Edinburgh. Addiewell also stands on a railway line and has an hourly service to both Edinburgh and Glasgow.
